Hero Description: From receiving a home to giving our lives. We serve God and the families of Baja California.
Historia P1: In 2010, our lives took a turn. We were blessed with a :casa_open Homes of Hope :casa_close house. It wasn't just walls; it was experiencing God's tangible love through strangers.
Historia P2: That day we decided we couldn't just "receive." We wanted to give. As a form of gratitude, we dedicated our lives to serving full-time at :jucum_open YWAM San Diego Baja :jucum_close .
Historia P3: "We know better than anyone that families need God, because we were there."
Familia Intro: Our service is a family project. We are grateful to God because our children are not just spectators, but an active part of the ministry.
Erick Jr Desc: Currently attending :uni_open University :uni_close . Erick stands out for his excellent GPA and participates in academic contests representing his school.
Lupita Desc: Attending :prep_open High School :prep_close . Like her brother, she maintains an excellent GPA and actively serves in the church.
Familia Footer: "We hope that one day they too will make a difference."
Ministerios Subtitle: Areas where we invest our hearts.
Envia Desc 1: A house doesn't transform a life completely if there isn't a change of heart. :strong_open ENVÍA :strong_close is a school for families who have already received a house.
Envia Desc 2: We run two schools a year (April and September). This year we discipled :families_open 19 families :families_close and celebrated :baptisms_open 4 baptisms :baptisms_close .
Vengan Desc: A refuge for moms. Here they learn to sew and study the Bible.
Vengan List 1: Generate income by sewing curtains for Homes of Hope.
Vengan List 2: More than 100 homes equipped this year.
Vengan List 3: A mom started a Bible study cell in her patio.
Casas Desc: Our work doesn't end with handing over the keys. We follow up with families, visiting them to ensure they connect with a local church and keep growing.
Iglesia Desc: We serve actively in our congregation. We help with the temple construction and spiritually guide new families that join.
Vision Desc: "Our desire is that we can continue in our calling with God, together with you. We imagine a community where every transformed family becomes an agent of change."
Objetivo Desc: Deepen discipleship in the new communities reached.
Transparencia Desc: We are full-time volunteer missionaries. :no_salary_open We do not receive a salary :no_salary_close from the organization. We depend 100% on donations to cover these areas:
Ministerio Card Desc: Teaching materials, sewing fabrics, gas for visits, and Bibles.
Sustento Card Desc: Rent, food, and basic services so we can serve without distractions.
Educación Card Desc: Support for Erick Jr.'s university and Lupita's high school.
FAQ 1 Q: How do I send a check from the USA?
FAQ 1 A: Send your check to :ywam_open YWAM San Diego/Baja :ywam_close . It is CRUCIAL that you include a separate note saying "For Erick Guzman". The address is: P.O. Box 5417, Chula Vista, CA 91912.
FAQ 2 Q: I want to send a package, is it the same address?
FAQ 2 A: :no_open No. :no_close Packages (FedEx, UPS, etc.) must be sent to our physical address: 1101 Bay Blvd, Suite C, Chula Vista, CA 91911. Attn: Erick Guzman.
FAQ 3 A: Yes, for donors in the United States. YWAM will issue a deductible receipt at the end of the year if the check is made out to the organization.
FAQ 4 Q: Do you receive a salary from YWAM?
FAQ 4 A: No. All YWAM staff members, from the founder to us, are unpaid volunteers and trust in God for our provision through sponsors.
Contact Desc: Have questions or want to support? Send us a direct message.
Donar Desc: Your generosity allows us to continue serving the families of Baja California.
Donar Instruccion: Click the button below and search for :name_open Erick Guzman :name_close in the list.
Galeria Desc: Visual testimony of what God is doing in our community.
Newsletters Desc: Stay up to date with our latest updates.
